section.title: What can you do on the Hierarchy view?

subsection.title: Drill down into the hierarchy
subsection.p: You can display children cards in the hierarchy by clicking on the show/hide children widget displayed to the left of the name of any card which has children. The expand/collapse state of the show/hide widget will be retained and any favorites created from the view will display the widget in the user selected state.

subsection.title: Add columns to the view
subsection.p: As in the List view, you can add columns to the hierarchy view by clicking on the Add / remove columns in the header.
Click on the name of the property you want to add and it will be added to the view. Clicking on the name of a property which is already displayed will remove it from the view.
subsection.note: If a card type in the hierarchy doesn't use a property, a black cell will be displayed for that column next to those cards.

subsection.title: Sort cards
subsection.p: As in the List view, you can sort the columns to the hierarchy view by clicking on the column header.

Unlike the list view, when sorting by type specific properties, such as 'planning estimate' which may only apply to stories, if parent levels of the tree are shown, the cards will be sorted within the parent i.e. the hierarchy structure will remain.

screenshot.alttext: Card tree - hierarchy view page, column sort, iterations shown

subsection.title: Maximize the view
subsection.p: The card hierarchy view can be viewed in the maximized mode. This will allow for cleaner, more useful views when working with your Mingle cards.

subsection.title: Create favorites
subsection.p: If you've found a card hierarchy view that your team will use regularly, you can save this view. You can then turn this into a tab.
You can also create personal favorites from card hierarchy views.

subsection.title: Import / Export cards
subsection.p: The Import / Export component lets you export the cards in the current hierarchy, or import a list of cards from Excel.
